Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a 60-Second Mindfulness-Based Video Exercise in Orthopaedic Practice

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-center, single-blind randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: 125 patients with upper extremity injuries at an urban academic hospital's orthopaedic practice

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to either a mindfulness-based video exercise or an attention placebo control (educational pamphlet)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates a 60-second personalized mindfulness-based video exercise's effectiveness and feasibility in an orthopaedic setting

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain intensity measured by the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) immediately post-intervention

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 125 patients were randomized and analyzed (mindfulness: 62, control: 63)

Number_Analysed.evidence: 125 patients were randomized and analyzed (mindfulness: 62, control: 63)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mindfulness group showed improved pain intensity (mean difference: 0.46, 95% CI 0.12-0.80, p=0.008)
